components.content:
If you're a British national getting a marriage or civil partnership abroad, you might need certain documents from the UK government, for example a certificate of no impediment (CNI).

Use this tool to find out how to get the documents you’ll need.

You’ll need to contact the local authorities where you want to get married to find out what you need to do.

Your marriage or civil partnership will be recognised in the UK if both of the following apply:

  • you followed the correct process in the country where you got married
  • it would be allowed under UK law
There’s a separate guide if you want to get married or enter into a civil partnership in the UK.

pages.title: Where do you want to get married?

components.name: countryPicker
components.title: Where do you want to get married?

components.content:
If you're getting married in Thailand you need to swear an affirmation that proves that you're free to get married.

You'll need to complete this form and swear an oath tha this is true.

You'll need to get your affirmation translated and legalised (certified as genuine) by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Thailand.

After you've had your documents legalisted you will need to them to the district office where you're getting married.

To get married in Thailand, the following must be true:

  • Your partner needs to be of the oppostive sex
  • Both people need to be over 17

In Thailand the only type of ceremony available is marriage. Civil Partnerships are not recgonised.

pages.title: To get an affirmation you'll need to

components.content:
1. Get you documents ready
     We'll tell you all the documents you need.
  2. Apply online
     Complete the form online
  3. Add your documents
     We'll show you how to upload your documents
  4. Pay for your application
     The affirmation costs £50
  5. Book your appointment
     You'll need to swear the oath in person at the embassy in Thailand

To complete the form you'll need:

  • Your British passport details
  • Your partner's details
  • Province and date of marriage
  • Details of 2 referees

You'll also need to add photos of your:

  • British passport
  • Evidence you changed your name by deed poll

If you've been married or in a civil partnership you'll need to provide:

  • Death certificate
  • Divorcer certificate or final order
Provide the details as they appear on your passport

We welcome your views on the registration service. If you agree to be contacted by answering 'yes'below, you will be consenting to share your personal data - name, email address, telpehone number and service received - with out independant partner research agency, IFF research. You may withdraw your consent at any stage by email consular.research@fco.gov.uk. For more details on how your data will be handled in relation to feedback please see the research privacy policy at www.gov.uk/fco/tell-fco

components.content:
If you're getting married in Thailand you need to swear an affirmation that proves that you're free to get married.

You'll need to complete this form and swear an oath tha this is true.

You'll need to get your affirmation translated and legalised (certified as genuine) by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Thailand.

After you've had your documents legalisted you will need to them to the district office where you're getting married.

Apply online for an affirmation of marital status

To get married in Frnace, you'll also need to get a certificate of custom.

A certificate of custom costs £50. The embassy will send your certificate 2 to 3 weeks after receiving your application.

! Warning You'll need to check if the name on your passport is the same as the name on your birth certificate. If the names are different, you'll have to provide the documents that show the name chaging

Some town halls or courts only accept a certificate of cusomt dated less that 6 months before your marriage

pages.title: How to get your affirmation of marital status
Is your partner of the opposite sex, or the same sex?

components.name: sameOrOppositeMarriage
components.title: Is your partner of the opposite sex, or the same sex?

components.content: You won’t be able to save this application – take pictures of the following documents before you start:
• your UK passport

How to take a photos of your documents

You can either take a photo with your mobile phone or scan the document.

We recommend you take a photo with your phone, and add it to the device you're completing the application form on.

Check that the photo you have taken is claer, and that all the details on your documents are visable.

components.title: Have you changed your name by deed poll?

pages.title: Add a photo of your passport

components.content:
Add a photo of the main page of your British passport - the page with the passport photo. We accept almost all file formats and sizes.

In addition

  • If your passport has been damaged, add a photo of the damage too (if it is not apparent on the main photo page).

components.title: How to photograph your document
components.content:
• Lay it flat on a table or for better results against a wall.
  • Make sure your address is readable.
  • No flash if possible.
  • Position the phone parallel to the document.
  • Use both hands to keep your phone steady.
If you wish to use a Thai address you will need to upload as a supporting documentation a photo of your yellow book or pink ID card.

pages.title: You can only apply for this service online if you have a British passport

components.content: If you don't have a British passport, but want to get married in France, please contact the British consulate in Paris.
